description: TimeWarp.Nuru example manifest for MCP server dynamic discovery

examples.name: Delegate Calculator Example
examples.description: Calculator using pure delegate routing - NO additional packages required beyond TimeWarp.Nuru. Maximum performance.

examples.name: Endpoints
examples.description: [NuruRoute] attribute pattern for auto-discovered endpoints with nested Handler classes. Supports [NuruRouteGroup] for prefixes and [NuruRouteAlias] for aliases.

examples.name: Mixed Pattern Calculator
examples.description: Mixed approach combining delegate performance with endpoints for complex operations.

examples.name: Delegate Calculator
examples.description: Pure delegate routing - NO additional packages required beyond TimeWarp.Nuru. Maximum performance with no DI overhead.

examples.name: Hello World
examples.description: Simplest possible Nuru app - a single route with a greeting. NO additional packages required beyond TimeWarp.Nuru.

examples.name: Async Command Examples
examples.description: Demonstrates async command handlers with Task-based routes and async/await patterns

examples.name: Console Logging Integration
examples.description: Shows how to integrate Microsoft.Extensions.Logging with console output

examples.name: Serilog Integration
examples.description: Demonstrates Serilog integration with structured logging and trace-level output

examples.name: Configuration Basics
examples.description: Demonstrates AOT-compatible AddConfiguration() with .settings.json files, strongly-typed options, and ConfigureServices with IConfiguration access

examples.name: Configuration Validation
examples.description: Fail-fast configuration validation using DataAnnotations, custom validation, and FluentValidation with ValidateOnStart()

examples.name: Command-Line Configuration Overrides
examples.description: ASP.NET Core-style command-line configuration overrides using --Section:Key=Value syntax

examples.name: REPL Basic Demo
examples.description: Interactive REPL mode with various route pattern types - literals, parameters, options, and subcommands

examples.name: REPL Custom Key Bindings
examples.description: Customize REPL key bindings with PSReadLine-style profiles (Emacs, Windows, Vi)

examples.name: REPL Interactive Mode
examples.description: CLI app with --interactive/-i flag to enter REPL mode

examples.name: REPL Options Showcase
examples.description: All REPL configuration options - prompts, history, welcome/goodbye messages

examples.name: Shell Tab Completion
examples.description: Static shell tab completion for Bash, Zsh, PowerShell, and Fish shells.

examples.name: Route Syntax Examples
examples.description: Comprehensive examples of all route pattern syntax - literals, parameters, types, options, catch-all

examples.name: Built-in Type Converters
examples.description: Demonstrates all built-in type converters: int, double, bool, DateTime, Guid, etc.

examples.name: Custom Type Converter
examples.description: Create custom IRouteTypeConverter implementations for your own types. Demonstrates EmailAddress, HexColor, and SemanticVersion converters with validation.

examples.name: IRouteTypeConverter Pattern
examples.description: Implement IRouteTypeConverter for custom parameter types. Shows TargetType, ConstraintAlias, and TryConvert pattern with practical examples.

examples.name: Testing Output Capture
examples.description: Use TestTerminal to capture and assert CLI output in unit tests - stdout, stderr, and exit codes

examples.name: Testing Colored Output
examples.description: Test handlers that produce colored/styled output using ANSI codes and fluent color extensions

examples.name: ITerminal Dependency Injection
examples.description: Inject ITerminal into route handlers for testable colored output with TestTerminal

examples.name: Runfile Test Harness
examples.description: Zero-modification testing pattern for runfiles using NuruTestContext, ModuleInitializer, and conditional compilation via Directory.Build.props

examples.name: Testing REPL Mode
examples.description: Programmatically test REPL mode using TestTerminal with QueueLine() and QueueKey() for input simulation - session lifecycle, commands, and assertions

examples.name: INuruBehavior Basics
examples.description: Global pipeline behaviors with INuruBehavior interface. Demonstrates logging and performance behaviors with HandleAsync(context, proceed) pattern.

examples.name: Filtered Behaviors with INuruBehavior<T>
examples.description: Type-safe filtered behaviors with INuruBehavior<TFilter>. Behaviors apply only to routes with .Implements<T>(). Example: AuthorizationBehavior with IRequireAuthorization.

examples.name: Complete Pipeline Middleware
examples.description: Complete reference with all pipeline behaviors: telemetry, performance, logging, authorization, retry, and exception handling.

examples.name: Pipeline Middleware - Basic
examples.description: Fundamental pipeline behaviors: logging and performance monitoring with before/after pattern.

examples.name: Pipeline Middleware - Authorization
examples.description: Permission checks using marker interface pattern. Commands opt-in via IRequireAuthorization.

examples.name: Pipeline Middleware - Retry
examples.description: Resilience with exponential backoff for transient failures. Commands opt-in via IRetryable.

examples.name: Pipeline Middleware - Exception Handling
examples.description: Consistent exception handling with categorized errors and user-friendly messages.

examples.name: Pipeline Middleware - Telemetry
examples.description: OpenTelemetry-compatible distributed tracing with Activity spans for observability.

examples.name: Aspire OpenTelemetry Integration
examples.description: OpenTelemetry integration with Aspire Dashboard - traces, metrics, and logs for CLI observability
